text: Hi guys, do you know where to post feedback about a bug on tickets?
this is exactly what I tried to do. But seems that there is a bug viewing email embedded videos
Hello, anyone know what permissions are required to enable this setting for my blog editors?
Found it: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/settings/HubSpot-user-roles-guide>
This also controls access to the campaigns tool under Producitivty > Campaigns.

You can insert other items, using loop.index -- at your specific iterations of the loop, you insert an item. Or, you can insert them out of the loop, and use jjquery/javascript to pop them in where you want them
Thanks <@U25PYL3Q8>, managed to get my head round this in the end, but thanks for the advice :thumbsup:
LOL DID not realize that was 7 days ago!
<@U22PU4G4A> while this article mentions you can now add videos to your file manager and use forms and ctas in them, it doesnt show how to actually do it.
For example, do the videos have to be in a certain folder? Also, how can I add the cta to the video?

Videos do not have to be in a certain folder. I believe you just have to insert a video into a blog post/LP/website page and then click on it to add a CTA/form. <@U7JSMT8JJ> can correct me if I'm wrong though.
ah ok cool. Ill play around with it in a bit to see
yes - if you'd opted in any video you upload to file manager moving forward will be using the new features
Also when you add a video to a rich text module in an lp or to any blog post you'll see a new "edit button" from there you can add CTAs and forms <@U2H3TT8F2>
If you reach out to support you can officially file one. But if you leave it here I can conmmunicate it directly to the team as well.

:wave: Hi All! Just wanted to introduce myself; I am the new Community Success Moderator for HubSpot's Community (<https://community.HubSpot.com/>). Let me know if you have any questions or thoughts about the Community-always happy to chat!

Hi and welcome.

just had this idea - take it or leave it - Might be cool on the community site to have an area for people to post links to their blog posts to be featured on that site, as well as integrate into the search that’s there.

The idea being right now there are very few HS Devs blogging about how they do things, and that means for most devs the only source of information is HubSpot’s own documentation. I think the encouragement of being able to post a blog post that would be accessible through the community portal would encourage developers to post how they do things more - spurring more developers, and people will build upon all that posting more complicated things etc, growing a community of higher quality HS devs.

this same sort of functionality would be great for designers and marketers too I think, though I think each category of people should be separated so it’s easier to see just the posts that make sense for you to see kinda thing.
open-source documentation :eyes:
hahaha I’m contagious apparently! I still support doing open-source documentation!
Hello <@UCSKU31SA>
Is there a help article on how to use the Wrapping HTML section of the design tools? Did some google searching and wasn’t able to find much
it places your code around your module/dragn drop item. in relation to `{{html}}`

Thanks for sharing, Jon! Definitely something that is our my radar as a way to enhance documentation and the Community. Stay tuned...when the time comes, I would love to gain your (and everyone's) input!
cool so I was just tying wrap the modules in an <a> tag
so how would that looks <@U7SL518D6>

don’t know the design you’re going for but that’s probably not a good idea.

That said it’d simply be `<a href="hardcodedlink.com">{{html}}</a>`
ok thanks - here is the page that I’m working on: <http://4kscore.bioreference.com/homepage>
it’s a prostate cancer website and I was looking to link the entire group of modules (icon module and text module) to a particular page.
can the module be cloned and use CMs to add a toggle for link?
yeah it could I guess
Like a toggle with an if statement to choose whether or not the item gets linked and then the content editors can input the links they need
yeah that is a good idea <@U2H3TT8F2>
thanks for the help!

*HS Devs: Noticing an issue with Video Embeds*

When you use a rich text field to insert a video via insert embed - it’s now no longer using the same class names that have been in the boilerplate forever it in-fact inserts an iframe with the class `.hs-responsive-embed-iframe` with no wrapper around the iframe breaking the responsive videos
it also directly contradicts your own blog posts talking about embedding responsive video in HubSpot

Article from this May showing the old class names used and the padding trick being used to create responsive videos <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/KCS_Article/COS-Pages-Editor/How-do-I-make-my-embedded-YouTube-video-responsive>

Also unless I’ve been living under a rock - because it doesn’t inject a wrapper around the iframe. it’s not physically possible to just adapt our code to make the new HS injected html work for responsive videos
I am guessing this issue was caused at the same time the vidyard video integration went live since they’re related
looks like it adds a huge padding to the video too so it def looks broken. A client actually emailed on this earlier this morning
<@U5SGFUU80> messaged, this was an unintentional change and they’re working on it.
<@U5SGFUU80> any update on the video issue?
I was told they’d update on my original post above when fixed. So I assume they’re still working on it
Good to know! thanks <@U7SL518D6>
^Yes, we've got it up on QA and we're doing a final review.  I will update here again when it's deployed fully.
Update - we're still working on some testing for this and I'll update again in the A.M.
